item.title: Photo highlights of the day
item.trailText: Buddha’s birthday, the Dirty Pig festival and a Lego Taylor Swift
item.standFirst: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world including Buddha’s birthday, the Dirty Pig festival and a Lego Taylor Swift

displayImages.caption: Buenos Aires, Argentina Fireworks explode over the Casa Rosada Presidential Palace during commemorations of the 204th anniversary of the May Revolution. Photograph: Marcos Brindicci/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Buenos Aires, Argentina Fireworks explode over the Casa Rosada Presidential Palace during commemorations of the 204th anniversary of the May Revolution.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Buenos Aires, Argentina Fireworks explode over the Casa Rosada Presidential Palace during commemorations of the 204th anniversary of the May Revolution.

displayImages.caption: Wroclaw, Poland A one-day old barbary macaque with its parents at their enclosure in Wroclaw’s Zoo. The Barbary macaque is of particular interest because males play an atypical role in rearing the young. Photograph: Maciej Kulczynski/EPA
displayImages.altText: Wroclaw, Poland A one-day old barbary macaque with its parents at their enclosure in Wroclaw’s Zoo. The Barbary macaque is of particular interest because males play an atypical role in rearing the young.
displayImages.cleanCaption: Wroclaw, Poland A one-day old barbary macaque with its parents at their enclosure in Wroclaw’s Zoo. The Barbary macaque is of particular interest because males play an atypical role in rearing the young.

displayImages.caption: Liverpool, UK Three Cunard liners – Queen Elizabeth, Queen Victoria and Queen Mary 2 – perform a synchronised manoeuvre on the river Mersey. The liners are visiting the city during a weekend of celebrations to mark the 175th anniversary of the Cunard Line Photograph: Paul Ellis/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Three Cunard liners, Queen Elizabeth, Queen Victoria and Queen Mary 2 perform a synchronised manoeuvre on the River Mersey in Liverpool
displayImages.cleanCaption: Liverpool, UK Three Cunard liners – Queen Elizabeth, Queen Victoria and Queen Mary 2 – perform a synchronised manoeuvre on the river Mersey. The liners are visiting the city during a weekend of celebrations to mark the 175th anniversary of the Cunard Line

displayImages.caption: Seoul, South Korea Workers attach name tags of Buddhist devotees who donated lanterns to celebrate the birthday of Buddha at the Chogye Temple Photograph: Ahn Young-joon/AP
displayImages.altText: Seoul, South Korea Workers attach name tags of Buddhist devotees who donated lanterns to celebrate the birthday of Buddha at the Chogye Temple
displayImages.cleanCaption: Seoul, South Korea Workers attach name tags of Buddhist devotees who donated lanterns to celebrate the birthday of Buddha at the Chogye Temple

displayImages.caption: Baoji, Shaanxi province, China Student nurses sit an exam Photograph: ChinaFotoPress/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Baoji, Shaanxi province of China Students from College of Nursing in a vocational school take part in graduation examination outside classroom o. Graduation examination is a matter of concerning students’ future and college students of a vocational school in northwest China’s Baoji in Shaanxi province conducted the test without teachers’ supervision
displayImages.cleanCaption: Baoji, Shaanxi province, China Student nurses sit an exam

displayImages.caption: London, UK Chelsea players take part in an open-top bus parade through Fulham to celebrate winning the Premier League title and the Capital One Cup Photograph: Leon Neal/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Chelsea football club players take part in an open-top bus parade through Fulham to celebrate winning the Premier League title and the Capital One cup
displayImages.cleanCaption: London, UK Chelsea players take part in an open-top bus parade through Fulham to celebrate winning the Premier League title and the Capital One Cup

displayImages.caption: Windsor, UK Pete Goodchild puts the finishing touches on a Lego mosaic of Taylor Swift at Legoland Photograph: Mikael Buck/Rex Shutterstock
displayImages.altText: Leogland Employee Pete Goodchild puts finishing touches on the mosaic Giant Lego Mosaic of 'Celebrity Best Friend' Taylor Swift Revealed at Legoland, Windsor
displayImages.cleanCaption: Windsor, UK Pete Goodchild puts the finishing touches on a Lego mosaic of Taylor Swift at Legoland

displayImages.caption: Hong Kong A girl has makeup applied before a Bun Festival parade at Cheung Chau island. The festival celebrates the islanders’ deliverance from plague many centuries ago and is meant to placate ghosts and restless spirits Photograph: Tyrone Siu/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Phoebe Lo has her make up applied as Peony Chu watches before the Bun Festival parade at Cheung Chau island, Hong Kong
displayImages.cleanCaption: Hong Kong A girl has makeup applied before a Bun Festival parade at Cheung Chau island. The festival celebrates the islanders’ deliverance from plague many centuries ago and is meant to placate ghosts and restless spirits

displayImages.caption: Maasai Mara, Kenya A lion escapes a herd of angry buffalo  by climbing a tree. The picture was taken in March by Charles Comyn, a 63-year-old ex-army official who was exploring the reserve with his wife Photograph: Charles Comyn/Barcroft Media
displayImages.altText: A lion escaped a herd of angry buffalo  by climbing a tree in the Massai Mara
displayImages.cleanCaption: Maasai Mara, Kenya A lion escapes a herd of angry buffalo  by climbing a tree. The picture was taken in March by Charles Comyn, a 63-year-old ex-army official who was exploring the reserve with his wife

displayImages.caption: Hergisdorf, Germany A participant wearing a Homer Simpson mask wallows in a puddle of mud during the Dirty Pig festival. The people of Hergisdorf use the annual event to banish the winter season Photograph: Peter Endig/EPA
displayImages.altText: A participant wearing a Homer Simpson mask wallows in a puddle of mud during the so-called Dirty Pig Festival
displayImages.cleanCaption: Hergisdorf, Germany A participant wearing a Homer Simpson mask wallows in a puddle of mud during the Dirty Pig festival. The people of Hergisdorf use the annual event to banish the winter season

displayImages.caption: Klettbach, Germany A folk dance group named Wenigensoemmern perform in traditional garb on German Windmill Day Photograph: Sebastian Kahnert/dpa/Corbis
displayImages.altText: A folk dance group named Wenigensoemmern perform during a mill festival as they wear traditional garb and carry flower garlands in front of Bockwindmuehle on German Windmill Day
displayImages.cleanCaption: Klettbach, Germany A folk dance group named Wenigensoemmern perform in traditional garb on German Windmill Day

displayImages.caption: Bujumbura, Burundi A protester jumps over a barricade during a demonstration against President Pierre Nkurunziza, a day after the funeral of the opposition leader Zedi Feruzi Photograph: Goran Tomasevic/Reuters
displayImages.altText: A protester jumps over a barricade during a protest against President Pierre Nkurunziza and his bid for a third term in Burundi
displayImages.cleanCaption: Bujumbura, Burundi A protester jumps over a barricade during a demonstration against President Pierre Nkurunziza, a day after the funeral of the opposition leader Zedi Feruzi

displayImages.caption: Ashgabat, Turkmenistan People gather in front of a monument to President Kurbanguly Berdymukhamedov during its inauguration ceremony. The six-metre-high statue depicts the leader on horseback perched on a white cliff Photograph: Reuters
displayImages.altText: People gather in front of a monument to President Kurbanguly Berdymukhamedov during its inauguration ceremony in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan
displayImages.cleanCaption: Ashgabat, Turkmenistan People gather in front of a monument to President Kurbanguly Berdymukhamedov during its inauguration ceremony. The six-metre-high statue depicts the leader on horseback perched on a white cliff

displayImages.caption: Sydney, Australia A boy wearing flippers lies on the shoreline as a surfer walks along Bondi beach Photograph: David Gray/Reuters
displayImages.altText: A boy wearing flippers lies on the shoreline as a surfer carrying his board walks along Bondi Beach, Sydney
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sydney, Australia A boy wearing flippers lies on the shoreline as a surfer walks along Bondi beach

displayImages.caption: South Carolina, US A customised bike is lit in neon lights as its driver waits in traffic on Ocean Boulevard during the Atlantic Beach Memorial Day BikeFest in Myrtle Beach Photograph: Randall Hill/Reuters
displayImages.altText: A customised sport bike is lit in neon lights as it’s driver waits in traffic on Ocean Boulevard during the Atlantic Beach Memorial Day BikeFest in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
displayImages.cleanCaption: South Carolina, US A customised bike is lit in neon lights as its driver waits in traffic on Ocean Boulevard during the Atlantic Beach Memorial Day BikeFest in Myrtle Beach
